snippet: Five couples challenged the Defense of Marriage Act because their legal marriages do not qualify the immigrant spouse for a green card.
abstract: Five legally married same-sex couples file a lawsuit to challenge the Defense of Marriage Act, a 1996 law that bars the federal government from recognizing same-sex marriages; suit argues that the legislation harshly impacts gay and lesbian immigrants who are seeking to gain legal residence through marriage to American citizens.
lead_paragraph: Five couples challenged the Defense of Marriage Act because their legal marriages do not qualify the immigrant spouse for a green card.

headline.seo: Noncitizens Sue Over U.S. Defense of Marriage Act
headline.main: Noncitizens Sue Over U.S. Gay Marriage Ban
headline.print_headline: Noncitizens Sue Over U.S. Gay Marriage Ban

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
